value: Section of a wall, Tapestry Room, Palace of Fontainebleau

label: Description
value: Elevation of section of wall, showing panelling and parts of large tapestries. Left, tapestry over mantelpiece. Right, side chair and commode.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and watercolor, Chinese white on heavy paper

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. Lloyd S. Bryce; 1896: Acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. Lloyd S. Bryce
Section of wall, Escalier de la cour ovale, Palace of Fontainebleau, France

label: Description
value: Section of wall, lower half, revetments with panels of vari-colored marble; upper half, painted panel (detail), set within frame and flanked by caryatid figures in relief.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and watercolor, tempera on heavy paper

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. Lloyd S. Bryce; 1896: Acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. Lloyd S. Bryce
Section of wall, salon Louis XIII, Palace of Fontainebleau, France

label: Description
value: Section of wall, with painted panels of arabesques and figures set within marble borders. Left, portrait of woman, Anne of Austria, in octagonal frame over door. Cupids with swags, in relief, flank portrait. Right, detail of mantlepiece.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and watercolor, tempera on heavy paper

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. Lloyd S. Bryce; 1896: Acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. Lloyd S. Bryce
Section of a wall showing groups of painted panels, Oval Chamber, Salon Louis XIV, Palace of Fontainebleau, France

label: Description
value: Section of wall, the wainscoting containing groups of small painted panels. Upper half, large painted panelsset in gold frames; right, portion of door with painted panels of royal monograms.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and watercolor, tempera on heavy paper

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. Lloyd S. Bryce; 1896: Acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. Lloyd S. Bryce
Detail of panel of Salon of Louis XIII

label: Description
value: Section of rectangular panel. Left, carved sides. It contains painted decoration: urn divides composition. Left, reclining youth holding garland of flowers. Extreme left, sphinx.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and watercolor, tempera on heavy paper

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. Lloyd S. Bryce; 1896: Acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. Lloyd S. Bryce
Section of wall, Guard Room, Palace of Fontainebleau

label: Description
value: Elevation of section of wall. Lower portion, containing groups of painted panels, chiefly including royal monograms and escutcheons as motifs of decoration. Upper portion, framed fabric, showing royal monogram against all-over pattern.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and watercolor, tempera on heavy paper

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. Lloyd S. Bryce; 1896: Acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. Lloyd S. Bryce
Detail, bed alcove, Palace of Fontainebleau

label: Description
value: Elevation of section wall. Right, part of bed alcove; left, doorway. Marble dado, with wall surface above decorated with panels contained in narrow gold frames with central and symmetric use of rocaille motifs.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and watercolor, tempera, Chinese white on heavy paper

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. Lloyd S. Bryce; 1896: Acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. Lloyd S. Bryce

label: Provenance
value: George Campbell Cooper; 1896: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Scrollwork panel with the bust of Temperance, four boys pouring water into bowls, and verse from Ecclesiastes.

label: Provenance
value: George Campbell Cooper; 1896: Acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Venus is shown from the rear holding the arms of Cupid.

label: Provenance
value: George Campbell Cooper; 1896: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Christ on the cross and the Virgin, St. Mary Magdalen, St. John. Broad frame with a glory and instruments of the Passion. Signed: "Eduart. ab Hoeswin[ckel]. excu. Anto. Wierinx scalp. M. de Vos inuentor U."

label: Provenance
value: George Campbell Cooper; 1896: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Titian, seen in three-quarter view, turned a little to the left. Below, the inscription: ILL. [superscript] MO ET R. [superscript] MO D. DN[accent]O HENRICO CAETANO S.R.E. CARD.APLE. [superscript] BON. [superscript] A[?] LEGATO / EXIGVVM HOC MVNVS IMAGINIS TITIANI PICT. CVIVS NOVEM ORBIS CONTINERE NON VALET SVBMISSE DICAT SACRATO[accent]VE / HVMILL.[superscript]S O[accent].SERVVS AVGVST.CARRATIVS. Date 1587 inscribed at lower right.

label: Provenance
value: George Campbell Cooper; 1896: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: The body of Christ is lifted by two disciples into the tomb. In mid-distance, six figures against the calvary and Jerusalem in background. Inscribed, lower left: "PARISI R OMANO INVENTORE / DIANA MATVANA INCIDEBAT"; lower right: "HORATIUS PACIFICUS FARNIS". Cut within platemark.

label: Provenance
value: George Campbell Cooper; 1896: acquired by Museum
The Archangels Michael, Gabriel, and Raphael Adoring the Madonna and Child

label: Description
value: Vigin and child, seated on a cloud, admired by the archangels Michael, Gabriel, and Raphael. Cut within platemark.

label: Provenance
value: George Campbell Cooper; 1896: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Standing figure of Mary Magdalen in frontal view. Her head is turned to left, lookking down. She holds a book in her right hand; her left hand rests upon a skull on a rock. In background, hills, houses, and a crucifix. Inscribed, lower left: H. Goltzius inuen. et sculptor exeubat"; center: "A 1585"; across lower margin: "Dum su a perpetua deplorat crimina fieta, grata pio, neruit Magdalis este deo". Cut within platemark.

label: Provenance
value: George Campbell Cooper; 1896: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: A boy, holding a bird in his right hand is about to climb on to the back of a large shaggy dog. The portrait is supposed to be that of the son of Theodore Frisius, the Venetian painter to whom Goltzius dedicated the print. Inscription and date 1597 with monogram H. Q.

label: Provenance
value: George Campbell Cooper; 1896: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: The Holy Family is placed at right: Virgin is kneeling in front of the Child; Joseph is feeding the donkey. At left, shepherds. Two angels behind the Child. Inscribed, lower left: "Annibal Caracius fecit et inue."; lower right: "Nic uan Aelst fec." Cut within plate mark.

label: Provenance
value: George Campbell Cooper; 1896: acquired by Museum
The Virgin Crowned by an Angel

label: Description
value: The full-length figure of the Virgin is represented seated on a bench, facing the spectator. She holds the Child with Her two hands, supporting Him on Her knees. A bird is on the Child's right hand. At upper left, an angel holds a crown of pearls over the Virgin's head. Monogram of Dürer and year "1520" on tablet, lower left.

label: Provenance
value: George Campbell Cooper; 1896: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: In central foreground Saint John baptizing Christ who is surrounded by angels. Inscribed, lower left: "J. Muller fecit"; lower right: "Harman Muller exc."; lower margin: "Christe, sator mundi, proses generosa Tonatis, / Sig iuuat impuros purus adine lacus / .O quam diuini mysteria sancta lauacri, Quo solet impurus purus abire lacu". Cut within plate mark.

label: Provenance
value: George Campbell Cooper; 1896: acquired by Museum
Judith, from the series "Heroes of the Old Testament"

label: Description
value: Judith stands in the foreground holding aloft the severed head of Holofernes. In her right hand she holds a sword. She is dramatically lit from the left which allows shadows to define her voluminous drapery. In the landscape behind her, there are hills to the left and at right, the tent where Judith is shown killing Holofernes.

label: Provenance
value: George Campbell Cooper; 1896: acquired by Museum. J&G Bouchier.

label: Notes
value: Judith stands in the foreground holding aloft the severed head of Holofernes. In her right hand she holds a sword. She is dramatically lit from the left which allows shadows to define her voluminous drapery. In the landscape behind her, there are hills to the left and at right, the tent where Judith is shown killing Holofernes.

label: Description
value: Saint Dominic in center oval, looking up toward the right, a star on his forehead. He holds a crucifix and lily in his right hand, a church and rosary in his left. Before him a skull, orb, dog with a torch. Three small scenes of his life around the frame. Below, the inscription: "Benedictus Redemptor. omnium qui saluti providens nominum, Mundo dedit, SANCTUM DOMENICUM. IESU bone, prece Domenici, tibi gratis praesta nos gratos effici. Below artist's and publisher's names.

label: Provenance
value: George Campbell Cooper; 1896: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Half-length portrait, turned toward the right, the head shown in three-quarter view. The hands are shown crossed before him. Signed in monogram in plate, lower left: [stylized LV]. Inscriptions in margin below: "DESIDERIVS ERASMVS TOTTERDAMVS ... ergo Numiliter Lucas"; lower left: "Vorsterman sculpter D.D."; center: "Hansus Holbenius pinxit"; lower right: "Cum Privilegye Reg."

label: Provenance
value: George Campbell Cooper; 1896: acquired by Museum
The Beheading of the Roman Judge Papinian, Plate 5 from "Thronus Justitiae"

label: Description
value: Interior view of a rectangular room. The beheaded body of Paparian lies obliquely in central foreground. Seven men surround it. In mid-distance a door into adjoining room where another man is being killed. Inscribed, lower left: "Stichem excud et editore J. Wtemwael inv. G. Swaneb. sculp."; lower margin: "Fratre trucidato Caracalla..."

label: Provenance
value: George Campbell Cooper; 1896: acquired by Museum
Jupiter and Mercury as Guests of Philemon and Baucis

label: Description
value: With the caption of four lines in the bottom margin. A poem of four verses, and the dedication of the print to the artist's father with the date.

label: Provenance
value: George Campbell Cooper; 1896: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Landscape with a valley at left, mountains and trees on right. Horizon at mid-distance. Inscribed, lower margin, center: "Aurora amomto noctem ... abore diem" / "16 H. Goude polat. comes, et  Aur. Mil. Eques. 13".

label: Provenance
value: George Campbell Cooper; 1896: acquired by Museum
Virgin and Child in the Clouds

label: Description
value: The Virgin and Child, upper left, in the clouds, with four putti. Below, under a tree, Saint Anthony looks up at them. A book lies open, to his right. Below, the inscription: "Sactore ANTONI quem nos superanimus hostem / Quod superas Coelo parta corna tibi est / Non mea sed vestia est victoria parta quod illa est / Lacte tuo Mater Sanguine Nate tuo". The artists' names below, and date.

label: Provenance
value: George Campbell Cooper; 1896: acquired by Museum
Portrait of Pieter Brueghel the Younger, from the Icones Principum Virorum

label: Description
value: A three-quarter length portrait of a man, turned toward the right, looking out at the spectator. The right hand is visible, holding the folds of his mantle. Columns in background. Inscription below: "PETRVS BREUGEL ANTVERPIAE PICTOR RVRALIVM ACTIONEM." At lower left: "Ant. van Dyck fecit acqua forti."

label: Provenance
value: George Campbell Cooper; 1896: acquired by Museum
Self-Portrait of Anthony van Dyck, from the Icones Principum Virorum

label: Description
value: Portrait, with the head alone etched, and with an indication of the collar. The head is turned toward the right, looking out at the spectator.

label: Provenance
value: George Campbell Cooper; 1896: acquired by Museum
Title Page, from the Icones Principum Virorum

label: Description
value: The bust of Anthony van Dyck on a pedestal, facing right, the head turned sharply over the right shoulder toward the spectator. On the square slab supporting the bus, left: "ANT. VAN DUCK:' right: "Ant. van Dyck fecit aqua forti." Flanking the pedestal are two heads of Mercury, with trumped and caduceus. On face of pedestal: "ICONES PRINCIPUM VIRORUM DOCTORUM,..followed by: "ANTWERPIAE/GILLIS HENDRICX EDCUDIT," in cartouche. At lower left: "Iac. Neeffs Sculpsit." The head etched by van Dyck, plate completed by Neeffs.

label: Provenance
value: George Campbell Cooper; 1896: acquired by Museum
Portrait of Frans Francken, from the Icones Principum Virorum

label: Description
value: Portrait of a man, his head turned slightly to the right, looking out at the spectator. His left hand appears from behind the folds of his cloak. Inscription below: FRANCISCUS FRANCK ANTWERPIAE PICTOR..." At lower left: "Ant. van Dyck fecit aqua forti."

label: Provenance
value: George Campbell Cooper; 1896: acquired by Museum
Portrait of Adam van Noort, from the Icones Principum Virorum

label: Description
value: Portrait of a bearded man, Adam van Noort (1562–1641), facing frontally, his head turned to the left. His left hand is visible, holding the folds of his cloak. A pillar, or section of wall, is seen behind the figure left.

label: Provenance
value: George Campbell Cooper; 1896: acquired by Museum
Portrait of Paulus Pontius, from the Icones Principum Virorum

label: Description
value: Portrait of a man, facing frontally, his head turned to the left. His right hand is visible, and he carries his mantle over his shoulder. Inscription below: 'PAULUS DU PONT CALCOGRAPHUS ANTWERPIAE." At lower left: "Ant. van Dyck fecit aqua forti."

label: Provenance
value: George Campbell Cooper; 1896: acquired by Museum
Portrait of Justus Sustermans, from the Icones Principum Virorum

label: Description
value: Portrait of a man, facing the spectator, the figure turned slightly to the left. His hands are visible, the left one resting on his hip. Inscription below: "IVSTVS SVTTERMAN S ANTVERPIENSIS PICTOR MAGNI DVCIS FLORENTINI." At lower left: "Ant. van Dyck fecit aqua forti."

label: Provenance
value: George Campbell Cooper; 1896: acquired by Museum
Portrait of Lucas Vorsterman I, from the Icones Principum Virorum

label: Description
value: Portrait of a man (Lucas Vorsterman [1624-after 1651/52]), the figure turned toward right; the head facing almost frontally, looking left. He wears a cloak, and his right hand is visible grasping it. Inscription below: "LVCAS VORSTERMANS CALCOGRAPHVS ANTWERPIAE IN GELDRIA NATVS." At lower left: "Ant. van Dyck fecit aqua forti."

label: Physical description
value: Etching and engraving on laid paper

label: Provenance
value: George Campbell Cooper; 1896: acquired by Museum

label: Provenance
value: George Campbell Cooper; 1896: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Two women at right, one seated on the bank of a stream, a second about to step in. A peasant with cattle and goats leads the way.

label: Provenance
value: George Campbell Cooper; 1896: acquired by Museum
The Virgin Sitting by a Wall

label: Description
value: In the foreground, the Virgin is seated, facing left, holding the infant Jesus with an apple in his hand on her knees.  A purse and a bunch of keys are suspended from the Virgin's girdle. The background is a view of a town. Behind the group at right, is a stone wall inscribed with the artist's monogram and the date "1514".

label: Provenance
value: George Campbell Cooper; 1896: acquired by Museum

label: Notes
value: In the foreground, the Virgin is seated, facing left, holding the infant Jesus with an apple in his hand on her knees. A purse and a bunch of keys are suspended from the Virgin's girdle. The background is a view of a town. Behind the group at right, is a stone wall inscribed with the artist's monogram and the date "1514".
